answers.answer: Guess no one has ever had this before...
Sorry hun to hear your having a hard time. I'm sorry I haven't ever had pre eclampsia so I have no idea. I hope you and you baby stay safe.
Are you having any other symptoms. And to swell during that time is normal. I am also 38 week's and have alot of swelling but my bp was normal.

I've had eclampsia, help syndrome, and preeclampsia. If the swelling is pitting (when you press it in, it stays indented and slowly puffs back out) and in the legs, feet, hands, face, that's a big sign of preeclampsia. Have the doc take your bp and do a urine protein dip.

I had Gestational hypertension that was getting really bad at the end and the protein wasn't bad but getting worse and worse slowly but my BP took a turn for the worse at the 37 week and she took baby at 37 +3 and is watching very close this time around because of that but as far as ur case goes I would hope if the swelling is bad that you are far enough along to be induced and they wouldn't make you wait. Has anything else been bad protein, bp???
Jesse how much was ur bp?

So far they take urine and test it like everyone else's, and they take blood to double check. My bp has been normal so far but longer I'm preggo the more nervous it seems we all get, I've been having contractions and dilating and effacing for weeks...I used a heating pad on my feet it seemed to help a little, going to tough it out until Fridays appointment.Thank you for the replies ladies!! <3
This might sound a bit strange and maybe even a little late,  but taking magnesium supplements and a small(er) amount of calcium with it has been shown to help. :)
My bp was anywhere from 140-90s to 180-100s my normal is 117/73 ish I was on meds too and it was that high.

I was going twice a week for a long time too. In and out of the hospital because of it. I got pregnant 3 months later with this pregnancy so I worry about it happening again because I have already been having some high readings. My dr changed me to everyother week visits earlier than normal because of it. I love my dr because she's on top of it! 27+4 today and this is when I started having problems with my son last year.
Good luck mama and hope u Don't have to go through this again
Messie ur saying magnesium help with bp?

Either way I'm 38 weeks if my bp high maybe she'll induce earlier than planned... My oldest was huge, I lost a lot of blood... That experience is all I know so I'm happy to just get it done at this point.

Yes magnesium (about 400mg elememtal) has been shown to help with hypertension and also risk of preeclampsia. vitamins d, c, e and k have roles to play too but c, e and k are easier to get from the diet. So I normally reccomend a lot of sun (and supplement if preexisting low levels of vit d) and magnesium with some calcium.

if you're going to supplement,  make sure you dont get magnesium oxide.... it can cause upset tummy and runny stools. get magnesium citrate or an amino acid chelated form of magnesium. Try to split the dose too if you have a sensitive tummy... like take200mg in the morning and 200mg at night. :)
My docs are inducing at 39 weeks for high bp. Guess it just depends. My bps have been 140-160s/80-90s (I'm on meds too).

question: Doctor has been testing for it, I'm high risk since I had it with my oldest... So far so good but today I'm swollen like nobodies business...Then I realized, if I have it, are they going to induce me early?I'm 38 weeks and Ready to be done but hoping it's not preeclampsia as it was a horrible and terrifying experience the first go round.
title: Question about preeclampsia....
